"General settings" tab
The settings of this tab are used to display the object in the registry or when opening it.
This tab is missing for the "Light Registry" registry type.+
The list of settings on this tab depends on the selected registry view.
For more information about the settings of this tab for the tiled registry, see this
article
.
Setting
Purpose
Visual on opening
Selecting the visual of the object that will be displayed when opening the object instance.
Algorithm for determining the list of performers
Configuring the list of performers in the task registry.
The algorithm should return an array of employeeâ€™s  system IDs.
The setting is displayed when selecting the
"Task Registry"
or
"Calendar Registry"
registry types.
Collapse hierarchy
The boolean parameter that determines the full/compact display of registry data by default upon opening it.
Possible options:
"Yes" - display only top-level parent objects in the hierarchy;
"No" - display all objects.
This setting is relevant for hierarchical datasets (regions, organizational structures, etc.).
The setting is displayed when selecting the "Registry with hierarchy" registry visual
.
Save immediately after removing focus
The switch that determines whether an instance can be automatically saved after removing focus from a row.
The parameter is displayed when selecting the "Flat registry" or "Registry with hierarchy" registry type
.
Use default editing mode
The switch that determines whether the registry attributes can be edited without going to the instance profile. Thus, editing values becomes available in the registry when an attribute (row) is clicked.
For more information about how the registry works in the edit mode, see the
article
.
The setting is displayed when selecting the "Flat registry" or "Registry with hierarchy" registry types
.
After saving changes by clicking the
button, the registry will be updated according to the applied settings.
